definition[0]: a thing used for washing floors, consisting of a long stick with threads of thick string or a piece of sponge fastened to one end
definition[1]: a thing used for cleaning dishes, consisting of a short stick with a piece of sponge fastened to one end
definition[2]: a large amount of thick, often untidy hair
example[1]: He ran a hand through his mop of fair hair.
definition[3]: to wash a floor with a wet mop
example[2]: She carried on mopping the floor.
definition[4]: to dry your face by rubbing it with a cloth or something soft
example[3]: It was so hot he had to keep stopping to mop his face.
example[4]: The doctor mopped his brow  (=removed sweat from his forehead) with a handkerchief.
definition[5]: to remove liquid from a surface by rubbing it with a cloth or something soft
example[5]: She gently mopped the blood from the wound.
example[6]: He mopped the sweat from his face.
example[7]: She mopped the tears away with a lacy handkerchief.
